intro: Daphnopsis americana subsp. guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan daphnopsis, is a member of the Ericaceae family and is native to Central America. It is a shrub characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in acidic soils. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually pink or white, adding ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly cultivated species.
